§ 2651. Establishment of Department There shall be at the seat of government an executive department to be known as the “Department of State”, and a Secretary of State, who shall be the head thereof. (R.S. § 199.)
Editorial Notes Codification R.S. § 199 derived from acts July 27, 1789, ch. 4, § 1, 1 Stat. 28; Sept. 15, 1789, ch. 14, § 1, 1 Stat. 68. Section was formerly classified to section 151 of Title 5 prior to the general revision and enactment of Title 5, Government Organization and Employees, by Pub. L. 89–554, § 1, Sept. 6, 1966, 80 Stat. 378.
